Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

commit.message: [BEAM-11432] put latest tag when publishing SDK head containers to gcr

nodes.bodyText: awesome, I didn't know this existed! thanks
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -41,12 +41,12 @@ job('beam_Publish_Beam_SDK_Snapshots') {
     gradle {
       rootBuildScriptDir(commonJobProperties.checkoutDir)
       commonJobProperties.setGradleSwitches(delegate)
-      tasks(':sdks:go:container:dockerPush')
+      tasks(':sdks:go:container:dockerTagPush')
       SUPPORTED_JAVA_CONTAINER_TASKS.each { taskVer ->
-        tasks(":sdks:java:container:${taskVer}:dockerPush")
+        tasks(":sdks:java:container:${taskVer}:dockerTagPush")

nodes.bodyText: By default this will always push latest tag, which I'm not sure we actually want to force. Would it be better to make docker-tag a comma-separated string list parameter and use split? That way we can also allow people to push more than one tag that isn't just latest.
Can you add comments that say this property only gets used by dockerTagPush? I think it will be confusing otherwise.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -41,12 +41,12 @@ job('beam_Publish_Beam_SDK_Snapshots') {
     gradle {
       rootBuildScriptDir(commonJobProperties.checkoutDir)
       commonJobProperties.setGradleSwitches(delegate)
-      tasks(':sdks:go:container:dockerPush')
+      tasks(':sdks:go:container:dockerTagPush')
       SUPPORTED_JAVA_CONTAINER_TASKS.each { taskVer ->
-        tasks(":sdks:java:container:${taskVer}:dockerPush")
+        tasks(":sdks:java:container:${taskVer}:dockerTagPush")
       }
       SUPPORTED_PYTHON_CONTAINER_TASKS.each { taskVer ->
-        tasks(":sdks:python:container:${taskVer}:dockerPush")
+        tasks(":sdks:python:container:${taskVer}:dockerTagPush")
       }
       switches("-Pdocker-repository-root=${imageRepo}")
       switches("-Pdocker-tag=${imageTag}")

nodes.bodyText: I'm not a huge fan of adding this default vs using tags = [project.rootProject["docker-tag"]] and having a caller provide docker-tag-list=${sdk_version},latest. Is this specific to work you are planning?

commit.message: add comment, remove default latest tag
